metadata.Title: CVE-2023-20593 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high
metadata.Description:
An issue in “Zen 2” CPUs, under specific microarchitectural circumstances,may allow an attacker to potentially access sensitive information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-20593` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-aws - 4.4.0-1125.131
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1169-azure - 4.15.0-1169.184~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: amd64-microcode: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'no real-world users').
linux package in trusty/esm is affected and needs fixing.
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-248.282~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1125.131').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1169.184~14.04.1').
